name: High Plank
how_to_perform:
1. Start in a high plank position with your hands placed shoulder-width apart on the ground and your body forming a straight line from your head to your heels.
2. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine, ensuring that your hips do not sag or pike upwards throughout the movement.
3. Keep your shoulders directly over your wrists, your back flat, and your glutes engaged to maintain proper form.
4. Hold this position for a specified time duration, usually 30-60 seconds, or until you feel fatigued in your core muscles.
short_summary: High plank is an isometric exercise that engages the entire core region, requiring stability, strength, and control.
